author: M Soundariya Preetha
text:
For Coimbatore, the New Year has dawned with hope and expectation of better air connectivity.

One of the long-pending demands of the district is more direct flight connectivity to more international destinations. “Ring roads and air connectivity are the two major needs of the district,” says V. Lakshminarayanaswamy, president of Southern India Engineering Manufacturers’ Association. With more flights, Coimbatore will get investments in different sectors, including Information Technology.

With representatives of industrial associations meeting Union Government officials and Ministers, the industry here is hopeful of getting flight connectivity to destinations such as Dubai.

The district needs more investments in the private sector this year for revival, says president of Coimbatore District Small Industries’ Association E.K. Ponnuswamy. When the Codissia Industrial Parks take off, there will be construction activities, creation of common infrastructure and capital investment too by the industries.

“We need more such investments in the private sector,” he says.

Similarly, sectors such as coir in Pollachi should be developed.

Any industrial development in the nearby places will bring orders and business to micro, small and medium-scale enterprises in Coimbatore, he says. “We need to support industrial sectors that are doing well and promote their growth.”
title: Coimbatore looks forward to better flight connectivity
